parts: Refer to the attached HTML file. In between the sections, "Why Choose SG Maths Tuition ..." and "Topics Covered in Secondary School Maths ...", I wish to create a new section that gives brief timetable details and includes a call to action - whatsapp number plus a link to contact form at page bottom, using ... For the CTAs, I want to use buttons of the same design (the "pill") as that used at the bottom of the right contact card in the "Contact" section (note that colour, border, and pill background change between light and dark mode). For timetable, I wish to state that both E Maths and A Maths Small Group Classes can be scheduled on Tue, Wed, Thur, Fri 3pm or 5pm, Saturday 930am, 1130am, 2pm, Sunday 930am, 1130am Help me come up with a simple but good looking design to succinctly convey the information in a very readable manner.
Make sure to include fileciteturn0file0 in your response to cite this file.

Skip to content
SG Maths Tuition
    Secondary Maths Tuition - Elementary & Additional Maths
    • 15+ years of experience
    • One to one / small group E Maths and A Maths classes
    • Comprehensive notes for each topic
    • Ample practice problems
    • Detailed monitoring of progress
    WhatsApp (65) 92997306 Contact Form

    Secondary School Maths Tuition in Singapore

    At SG Maths Tuition, we provide personalised one-to-one and small group tuition for Secondary level Maths (E Maths and A Maths).

    The lessons are anchored by Dr Ng, who has a Ph.D. in Mathematics and has over 15 years of tutoring experience.

    We tailor lessons to the needs of each student and provide customized study plans. Whether you're struggling with foundational concepts or aiming for top marks in your exams, we focus on making the study of math engaging, rewarding, and, most importantly, effective.

    Why Choose SG Maths Tuition for Elementary Maths and Additional Maths Tutoring?

    Highly personalized one-to-one and small group classes

    Students have different learning needs. We provide highly personalized lesson plans for every student and adjust the style and pace of teaching accordingly. This ensures each student gets sufficient attention and finds the lessons productive and effective.

    Experienced Tutor with Deep Mathematical Expertise

    Dr Ng is a private tutor with over 15 years of experience. Armed with a Ph.D. in Mathematics and B.Sc. First Class Honours in Mathematics from the National University of Singapore, he brings unparalleled knowledge and expertise. He is well-versed in the latest Ministry of Education (MOE) syllabus.

    Proven Track Record

    Many of Dr Ng's students achieve a two to four grade improvement over the duration of study. This is accomplished by building a good foundation for each student, getting each student familiar with the different types of questions commonly asked for each topic, and consistently practicing all the common problem solving methods.

    Comprehensive and Customised Learning Materials

    Each student receives personalised worksheets, practice papers and study materials, all of which are carefully crafted to support their learning. We go beyond typical textbooks to provide academic content that is exam-focused, ensuring targeted preparation for tests and exams.

    Intensive Examination Preparation

    We conduct June holiday bootcamps, mock tests and timed quizzes to help students prepare for tests and examinations. Our topical worksheets and practice papers help students revise efficiently and improve their time management during exams. We aim to reduce stress, improve confidence, and increase learning satisfaction.

    Consistent Feedback and Monitoring

    We believe in the importance of communication. We update parents consistently on the progress of the students, and also give students frequent feedback on their areas of weakness so that they know which topics to focus on. We share tips, strategies and exam techniques with students and parents.

    Topics covered for Secondary School Maths

    Elementary Mathematics

    1. Prime Factorization, HCF, LCM
    2. Numbers and Approximation
    3. Single and Simultaneous Linear Equations
    4. Linear Graphs including use of linear graphs to solve simultaneous equations
    5. Application Problems involving Linear Graphs
    6. Ratio, Rate, Proportion, Percentages, Simple Interest
    7. Applications of Rate and Percentages including Distance-Speed-Time questions, Income Tax, GST, Hire Purchase, Profit and Loss, Sales Commission, Exchange Rates
    8. Polygons
    9. Geometric Constructions including perpendicular bisector and angle bisector
    10. Mensuration - Squares, Rectangles, Circles, Parallelograms, Rhombuses, Trapeziums, Cubes, Cuboids, Prisms, Cylinders, Pyramids, Cones, Spheres and Hemispheres
    11. Number Patterns
    12. Single and Combined Linear Inequalities
    13. Expansion and Factorization
    14. Special Algebraic Identities
    15. Algebraic Fractions
    16. Making a Variable the Subject of the Formula
    17. Quadratic Functions, Completing the Square, Quadratic Graphs
    18. Equations involving Quadratic Expressions, Algebraic Fractions, and Applications to Real World Problems
    19. Indices, Standard Form, Compound Interest
    20. Coordinate Geometry
    21. Graphs of Functions and Graphical Solutions
    22. Pythagoras' Theorem, Trigonometry and Further Trigonometry
    23. Applications of Trigonometry
    24. Arc Length, Sector Area, Radian Measure
    25. Congruency and Similarity Tests for Triangles
    26. Areas and Volumes of Similar Figures and Solids
    27. Geometric Properties of Circles
    28. Sets
    29. Probability of Single and Combined Events
    30. Matrices and their use in Real World Problems
    31. Statistical Data Analysis
    32. Vectors

    Additional Mathematics

    1. Quadratic Functions, Equations, Graphs, Completing the Square, use of the Discriminant, Quadratic Inequalities, Simultaneous Equations involving a Linear and Quadratic Equation, Applications of Quadratic Functions
    2. Surds and Application Problems involving Surds
    3. Polynomials including Factor and Remainder Theorems, Cubic Equations, Cubic Identities, Partial Fractions
    4. Binomial Theorem and its Applications
    5. Exponential and Logarithmic Functions and Equations, Exponential and Logarithmic Graphs
    6. Coordinate Geometry including distance formula, midpoint formula, perpendicular lines, shoelace formula, angle between line and axes
    7. Linear Law
    8. Trigonometric Graphs
    9. Trigonometric Functions and Equations including Basic Angle, ASTC
    10. Trigonometric Identities and Formulae including Compound Angle, Double Angle and Half Angle Formulae, R-Formulae, Proving Identities
    11. Differentiation: Gradients, Derivatives, Differentiation Techniques
    12. Applications of Differentiation: Increasing and Decreasing Functions, Tangent and Normal Lines, Rates of Change, Stationary Points including First and Second Derivative Tests, Maxima and Minima Problems
    13. Differentiation of Trigonometric, Exponential, Logarithmic Functions, and their Applications
    14. Integration
    15. Applications of Integration
    16. Kinematics
    17. Proofs in Plane Geometry: Using concepts from congruency and similarity of triangles, geometric properties of circles, alternate segment theorem, midpoint theorem

    Contact

    Contact Information

    Complete the form or connect with me directly using the details below.

    DN
    Dr Ng
    Founder & Tutor
    SG Maths Tuition
    WhatsApp +65 9299 7306
    Email Me
    integrated.math.tuition@gmail.com
    5-minute walk from Kovan MRT
    Programme I'm interested in
    Singapore numbers only.
    0 of 600 characters
    © Integrated Math and Science Tuition | Singapore | integrated.math.tuition@gmail.com | +65 9299 7306 | v1.1.0

thoughts.summary: Creating a new section with CTA buttons
thoughts.content:
The user wants to insert a new section between "Why Choose" and "Topics Covered" with a succinct timetable and CTA buttons using a "pill" design from the "Contact" section. I'll adapt existing styles, especially those for button pills and ensure color/border changes between light/dark mode.

I’ll insert the code in a way that fits well within the site’s design aesthetics and reference the relevant files.

The task requires citing references with proper line numbers, but the displayed file content doesn’t have line numbers this time. Ideally, I'd provide citations with the expected markers, but since they're absent, I can still proceed with contextual references and adjust the format as needed.

The instructions seem to ask for line numbers, but the latest message stresses citing without line ranges. I’ll prioritize this more specific direction. I'll go with basic citations from the files without worrying about line numbers. For code, I'll provide minimal HTML and CSS that matches the site, reusing the existing .btn-pill style.

The new section should align with existing design patterns like .section, .section--split, and .section--topics. I think a new .section--schedule or .section--timetable class might be necessary. For minimal CSS, I’ll prefer adding to secondary-maths.css. For displaying schedules, I'll use a responsive card split into weekdays and weekends with time chips. These chips will follow the existing .btn-pill design but will be static without CTA functionality. We can also use Flexbox to wrap the time list neatly.

I'll add a simple, clean timetable featuring weekdays and weekend slots with chips for times. For consistency, I'll ensure the CTAs match the contact card style, using `.btn-pill` and a custom `.btn-pill--ring`. We’ll keep the design accessible, responsive, and in line with the rest of the page with minimal CSS. The HTML will include proper sectioning for clarity, and I’ll make sure to use ARIA attributes for accessibility. I'll ensure it's mobile-friendly based on the requirements with the needed CSS and minimal JS for anchor linking to WhatsApp.

parts: Thank you. For the "Book a trial" block, space out the contents more so they do not appear cluttered, remove the underline for the hyperlinks, and make the block the same height as the " Maths & A Maths small-group classes" block. Also add some space between the <h2> title and the contents that follow -- for both the "Small-Group Timetable  ..." section and the "Topics covered for Secondary School Maths" section.

thoughts.content: I need to increase spacing in the "Book a trial" section to avoid a cluttered look. I'll adjust the line-height and margins between elements, and maybe tweak the gap in `.actions`. I'll also remove the hyperlinks' underlines and make the block’s height match the “Maths & A Maths” section. I'll take care of these CSS adjustments!

I need to adjust the layout so that the "schedule-cta" block matches the height of the "schedule-card." To do this, I'll use CSS grid and set `align-items: stretch` for `.schedule-wrap`. This way, all grid items will stretch to the tallest content in their row, providing equal heights.

For mobile, I don’t need to worry too much about columns, but I do want the "schedule-card" and "schedule-cta" sections to use `display: flex`. I'll set `flex-direction: column` on the "schedule-cta" and increase the gap for spacing, ensuring actions are at the top. To fix any height issues between the two, I’ll use `align-items: stretch`, which should automatically adjust both elements to equal height.

To remove the underline from hyperlinks, I can add `.section--schedule .btn-pill { text-decoration: none; }`. For the spacing between the `<h2>` title and the content, I’ll increase the `margin-bottom` for `.section-title` (e.g., `clamp(18px, 2.8vw, 30px)`) and apply similar styling for the topics section. I'll adjust that for both "Small-Group Timetable" and "Secondary School Maths" sections.

I’ll provide the necessary updates for CSS based on the user’s request. The "Book a trial" block will have its contents spaced out with `display:flex` and adjusted padding. I'll remove underlines from buttons and ensure equal height by using `align-items: stretch` and `height: 100%`. For both title sections, I'll increase the margin to space out the content. I'll also check markup for the topics section to make sure the styles apply correctly.

content.text:
from pathlib import Path, PurePosixPath, PurePath
html_path = Path('/mnt/data/secondary-maths-tuition-singapore.html')
css1 = Path('/mnt/data/secondary-maths.css')
css2 = Path('/mnt/data/tuition-css-1.0.1-phase8.css')
print(html_path.exists(), css1.exists(), css2.exists())
print("HTML size", html_path.stat().st_size if html_path.exists() else None)
print("CSS1 size", css1.stat().st_size if css1.exists() else None)
print("CSS2 size", css2.stat().st_size if css2.exists() else None)

content.text:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en" data-theme="auto" class="no-js">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <title>Secondary Maths Tuition in Singapore | SG Maths Tuition</title>
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <meta name="description"
        content="E-Maths & A-Maths tuition for Sec 3 & 4 by PhD tutor (15+ years experience). Strengthen foundations, master problem-solving, build confidence for O-Levels and IP" />

    <link rel="preconnect" href="https://www.googletagmanager.com" crossorigin />

    <!-- Theme preloader: keep identical behavior -->
    <script>
        (function () {
            try {
                var saved = localStorage.getItem("theme"); // 'light' | 'dark' | null
                var prefersDark =
                    window.matchMedia &&
                    window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)").matches;
                var theme = saved || (prefersDark ? "dark" : "light");
                if (theme === "dark")
                    document.documentElement.setAttribute("data-theme", "dark");
                else document.documentElement.setAttribute("data-theme", "light");
            } catch (e) { }
        })();
    </script>

    <link rel="preload" as="image" href="assets/media/hero-a-768.jpg" media="(max-width: 1439px)" />
    <link rel="preload" as="image" href="assets/media/hero-a-1536.jpg" media="(min-width: 1440px)" />

    <!-- Base site CSS (unchanged) -->
    <link rel="stylesheet" hr

SG Maths Tuition
    Secondary Maths Tuition - Elementary & Additional Maths

    WhatsApp (65) 92997306 Contact Form

    Secondary School Maths Tuition in Singapore

    At SG Maths Tuition, we provide personalised one-to-one and small group tuition for Secondary level Maths (E Maths and A Maths).

    The lessons are anchored by Dr Ng, who has a Ph.D. in Mathematics and has over 15 years of tutoring experience.

    We tailor lessons to the needs of each student and provide customized study plans. Whether you're struggling with foundational concepts or aiming for top marks in your exams, we focus on making the study of math engaging, rewarding, and, most importantly, effective.

    Why Choose SG Maths Tuition for Elementary Maths and Additional Maths Tutoring?

    Highly personalized one-to-one and small group classes

    Students have different learning needs. We provide highly personalized lesson plans for every student and adjust the style and pace of teaching accordingly. This ensures each student gets sufficient attention and finds the lessons productive and effective.

    Experienced Tutor with Deep Mathematical Expertise

    Dr Ng is a private tutor with over 15 years of experience. Armed with a Ph.D. in Mathematics and B.Sc. First Class Honours in Mathematics from the National University of Singapore, he brings unparalleled knowledge and expertise. He is well-versed in the latest Ministry of Education (MOE) syllabus.

    Proven Track Record

    Many of Dr Ng's students achieve a two to four grade improvement over the duration of study. This is accomplished by building a good foundation for each student, getting each student familiar with the different types of questions commonly asked for each topic, and consistently practicing all the common problem solving methods.

    Comprehensive and Customised Learning Materials

    Each student receives personalised worksheets, practice papers and study materials, all of which are carefully crafted to support their learning. We go beyond typical textbooks to provide academic content that is exam-focused, ensuring targeted preparation for tests and exams.

    Intensive Examination Preparation

    We conduct June holiday bootcamps, mock tests and timed quizzes to help students prepare for tests and examinations. Our topical worksheets and practice papers help students revise efficiently and improve their time management during exams. We aim to reduce stress, improve confidence, and increase learning satisfaction.

    Consistent Feedback and Monitoring

    We believe in the importance of communication. We update parents consistently on the progress of the students, and also give students frequent feedback on their areas of weakness so that they know which topics to focus on. We share tips, strategies and exam techniques with students and parents.

    Secondary Maths Small-Group Timetable & Booking

    E Maths & A Maths small-group classes: 2 hours per class, $840 for 8 lessons (billed in advance)

    Weekdays (Tue–Fri)

    • 3:00 pm
    • 5:00 pm

    Saturday

    • 9:30 am
    • 11:30 am
    • 2:00 pm

    Sunday

    • 9:30 am
    • 11:30 am

    Slots subject to availability; contact to confirm.

    Book a trial or ask a question

    Fastest: WhatsApp. Or use the contact form below.

    WhatsApp +65 9299 7306 Contact Form

    Location: 5-minute walk from Kovan MRT

    Topics covered for Secondary School Maths

    Elementary Mathematics

    1. Prime Factorization, HCF, LCM
    2. Numbers and Approximation
    3. Single and Simultaneous Linear Equations
    4. Linear Graphs including use of linear graphs to solve simultaneous equations
    5. Application Problems involving Linear Graphs
    6. Ratio, Rate, Proportion, Percentages, Simple Interest
    7. Applications of Rate and Percentages including Distance-Speed-Time questions, Income Tax, GST, Hire Purchase, Profit and Loss, Sales Commission, Exchange Rates
    8. Polygons
    9. Geometric Constructions including perpendicular bisector and angle bisector
    10. Mensuration - Squares, Rectangles, Circles, Parallelograms, Rhombuses, Trapeziums, Cubes, Cuboids, Prisms, Cylinders, Pyramids, Cones, Spheres and Hemispheres
    11. Number Patterns
    12. Single and Combined Linear Inequalities
    13. Expansion and Factorization
    14. Special Algebraic Identities
    15. Algebraic Fractions
    16. Making a Variable the Subject of the Formula
    17. Quadratic Functions, Completing the Square, Quadratic Graphs
    18. Equations involving Quadratic Expressions, Algebraic Fractions, and Applications to Real World Problems
    19. Indices, Standard Form, Compound Interest
    20. Coordinate Geometry
    21. Graphs of Functions and Graphical Solutions
    22. Pythagoras' Theorem, Trigonometry and Further Trigonometry
    23. Applications of Trigonometry
    24. Arc Length, Sector Area, Radian Measure
    25. Congruency and Similarity Tests for Triangles
    26. Areas and Volumes of Similar Figures and Solids
    27. Geometric Properties of Circles
    28. Sets
    29. Probability of Single and Combined Events
    30. Matrices and their use in Real World Problems
    31. Statistical Data Analysis
    32. Vectors

    Additional Mathematics

    1. Quadratic Functions, Equations, Graphs, Completing the Square, use of the Discriminant, Quadratic Inequalities, Simultaneous Equations involving a Linear and Quadratic Equation, Applications of Quadratic Functions
    2. Surds and Application Problems involving Surds
    3. Polynomials including Factor and Remainder Theorems, Cubic Equations, Cubic Identities, Partial Fractions
    4. Binomial Theorem and its Applications
    5. Exponential and Logarithmic Functions and Equations, Exponential and Logarithmic Graphs
    6. Coordinate Geometry including distance formula, midpoint formula, perpendicular lines, shoelace formula, angle between line and axes
    7. Linear Law
    8. Trigonometric Graphs
    9. Trigonometric Functions and Equations including Basic Angle, ASTC
    10. Trigonometric Identities and Formulae including Compound Angle, Double Angle and Half Angle Formulae, R-Formulae, Proving Identities
    11. Differentiation: Gradients, Derivatives, Differentiation Techniques
    12. Applications of Differentiation: Increasing and Decreasing Functions, Tangent and Normal Lines, Rates of Change, Stationary Points including First and Second Derivative Tests, Maxima and Minima Problems
    13. Differentiation of Trigonometric, Exponential, Logarithmic Functions, and their Applications
    14. Integration
    15. Applications of Integration
    16. Kinematics
    17. Proofs in Plane Geometry: Using concepts from congruency and similarity of triangles, geometric properties of circles, alternate segment theorem, midpoint theorem

    Contact

thoughts.content: The user wants FAQs for a page, likely Singapore-specific. Topics might include E Maths/A Maths, class formats, fees, trial lessons, cancellations, contact details, scheduling, teaching qualifications, location (Kovan MRT), progress tracking, and safety. It’s crucial not to introduce contradictory or incorrect information—especially regarding pricing or services detailed on the page.

The user wants suggestions for suitable FAQs. I can suggest questions like "What are the fees?" mentioning the $840 for 8 lessons—but I need to be careful not to contradict any information. For "How many students per group?" I'll suggest "typically 2–4, capped at 4", but not confirm it as fact since it's not specified.

I’ll draft a list of 15-20 FAQs, covering categories like Scheduling & Booking, Lessons & Materials, Assessment & Results, and Admin & Fees. The answers will align with the page information, using placeholders where needed (like class size). I should ensure precision and objectivity, and leave space for user confirmation where necessary.

The user asked for questions suitable for the FAQ page. I'll provide a set of 12-18 topics with concise answers, making sure they align with the page details. I'll suggest clear answers with a consistent style. The anchor links, contact info, and CTA buttons should match their current page style, but I won't add code unless it’s truly helpful.

I'll draft FAQs around topics like schedule, fees, trial lessons, and policies (e.g., make-up classes, capacity, payment methods). I'll keep answers brief and grounded in the page info, adding placeholders for areas that need confirmation, like class size. For any additional policy suggestions, I'll mark them as "editable". I'll be sure to cite the file with "(website)" as directed.

I’ll propose an FAQ list covering everything from class sizes and schedule to trial lessons and policies. These FAQs will be carefully designed with SEO in mind, including keywords like “E Maths vs A Maths”. After that, I’ll provide an optional HTML code snippet for the FAQ section, plus a JSON-LD snippet for SEO. I'll ensure clarity, be concise, and stick to facts for the content—no confusing policy claims. I’ll add the necessary file citation at the end.

parts:
Here’s a tight, conversion-oriented FAQ set that matches what your page already states (subjects, schedule, fees, pedagogy, location, contact), plus a few optional “policy” questions you can include if you’re ready to commit. fileciteturn1file0 # Recommended FAQs (with succinct answers) ## Must-have (top of the list) 1) **What levels and subjects do you teach?** Upper Secondary (Sec 3–4), **E-Maths** and **A-Maths**. IP-year equivalents welcome. fileciteturn1file0 2) **Who is the tutor?** Dr Ng (Ph.D. in Mathematics; 15+ years’ tutoring experience). fileciteturn1file0 3) **When are the small-group classes?** Tue–Fri: **3:00 pm** or **5:00 pm**. Sat: **9:30 am**, **11:30 am**, **2:00 pm**. Sun: **9:30 am**, **11:30 am**. fileciteturn1file0 4) **How long is each class and what are the fees?** Each class is **2 hours**. Small-group package: **$840 for 8 lessons** (billed in advance). fileciteturn1file0 5) **How do I book a trial or ask a question?** Fastest is WhatsApp **+65 9299 7306**, or use the **[contact form](#contact)**. fileciteturn1file0 6) **Where are lessons held?** Near **Kovan MRT** (about a 5-minute walk). fileciteturn1file0 ## Programme & pedagogy 7) **Do you offer one-to-one as well as small-group classes?** Yes—one-to-one and small-group are both available (subject to slot availability). fileciteturn1file0 8) **Is the syllabus aligned with MOE requirements?** Yes—teaching is aligned to the latest MOE syllabus. fileciteturn1file0 9) **What materials do students receive?** Personalised worksheets, practice papers and study notes crafted for each student. fileciteturn1file0 10) **Do you provide exam preparation?** Yes—June bootcamps, mock tests and timed quizzes to build speed and confidence. fileciteturn1file0 11) **How do you monitor progress?** Regular feedback to students and periodic updates to parents on areas to focus on. fileciteturn1file0 ## Optional policy items (include only if you’re ready to commit) 12) **Class size / cap** (Example: “Capped at X students to keep attention high.”) 13) **Make-up & rescheduling** (Example: “With ≥24–48h notice, we’ll try to slot you into an alternative class.”) 14) **Public holidays / school holidays** (Example: “No classes on public holidays; selected sessions run during school holidays.”) 15) **Payment methods & billing cycle** (Example: “PayNow / bank transfer. Packages billed before the first lesson of each block.”) 16) **Starting mid-term** (Example: “You can join mid-term; we’ll bridge any gaps with targeted materials.”) --- # Optional: Drop-in HTML (accessible, compact) If you’d like this rendered now, paste the block below right **before** the Contact section. It uses semantic `
`/`` so it’s scannable and keyboard-friendly. You can add or remove items easily. ```html

Frequently Asked Questions

What levels and subjects do you teach?

Upper Secondary (Sec 3–4), E-Maths and A-Maths. IP-year equivalents welcome.

Who is the tutor?

Dr Ng (Ph.D. in Mathematics; 15+ years’ tutoring experience).

When are the small-group classes?

Tue–Fri: 3:00 pm or 5:00 pm. Sat: 9:30 am, 11:30 am, 2:00 pm. Sun: 9:30 am, 11:30 am.

How long is each class and what are the fees?

Each class is 2 hours. Small-group package: $840 for 8 lessons (billed in advance).

How do I book a trial or ask a question?

WhatsApp +65 9299 7306 or use the contact form.

Where are lessons held?

About a 5-minute walk from Kovan MRT.

Do you offer one-to-one as well as small-group classes?

Yes—one-to-one and small-group are both available (subject to slot availability).

Is the syllabus aligned with MOE requirements?

Yes—teaching is aligned to the latest MOE syllabus.

What materials do students receive?

Personalised worksheets, practice papers and study notes crafted for each student.

Do you provide exam preparation?

Yes—June bootcamps, mock tests and timed quizzes build speed, accuracy and confidence.
